title: Theta Positivity in Lagrangian Grassmannian
abstract:
We study the theta nonnegative part of Lagrangian Grassmannian. We show that
it admits an orbital decomposition and is homeomorphic to a closed ball. We
compare it with other positive structures. We show that it contains several
totally nonnegative parts of Lagrangian Grassmannian subject to certain choices
of pinnings and agrees with the nonnegativity of the generalized Pl\"ucker
coordinates.
